Conclusion and Elation

Jan 27, 2019

Enchanting sapphire eyes
And comely freckled face
I find it no surprise
My heart should stand in place

I never thought it wise
For love to come apace
Yet, some feelings arise
No wisdom can efface

That zeal the mind belies
The heart cannot debase
In time it time it will abscise
False wisdom and show grace

What joy to be unwise
And love, therefore, embrace
What hope to lose the lies
And find you in their place

© 2021 Michael Halstead
